subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Frank's Box on Paranormal State Tonight
author: Marlboro63@aol.com
full_text:
-------------------------------1203362011
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="US-ASCII"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

Hi Frank,
 
I just wonder where they got the idea that Chris Moon was the  inventor?  
They wouldn't of just "assumed" that considering it is named  "Frank's Box"?
 
Jeff
 
 
In a message dated 2/18/2008 1:08:05 P.M. Central Standard Time,  
warrior18eii@... writes:

 
 
 
 
I  emailed Ryan that ya'll are trying to reach his producers. Maybe you will 
hear  something back sooner.

Regards,

Frank R.

-----  Original Message ----
From: "Marlboro63@From: "Marlbo<Marlboro63@...>
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroupsTo: 
Sent:  Monday, February 18, 2008 12:55:11 PM
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Frank's  Box on Paranormal State Tonight


I emailed them and am hoping for a  response back too.  But I doubt I will 
get it.
 
Jeff
 
 
In a message dated 2/18/2008  12:38:40 P.M. Central Standard Time, 
ghostchasingfool@ _yahoo.com_ (http://yahoo.com/)   writes:

 
 
 
That's  ok Nellie, I will be setting the record straight pretty soon with the 
help  of some dear friends.  
 
Juli

purplespacefriend <purplealiengirl@ _live.com_ (http://live.com/) > wrote:

 
I  e-mailed them--no response. I don't think they are all that 
concerned  with facts.

Frank-S
--- In _EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com_ (mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com) ,  
rednellie <rednellie@. ..> wrote:
>
> I just ran across  this episode description on A&E website:
> 
> "PRS  explores the belly of the beast: a New York State Prison that 
was  
> once a mental asylum. Ryan and his team go behind bars to uncover  
the 
> institution' s paranormal past and present--current  inmates and 
guards 
> are reporting mysterious new sightings!  For their biggest case yet 
PRS 
> enlists the help of psychic  Chip Coffey, demonologist Lorraine 
Warren 
> and Chris Moon, the  owner/inventor of the latest in paranormal 
> technology, "Frank's  Box," a radio designed to communicate with the 
dead"
> 
>  I think they have their details a bit wrong. :-P
> 
> 
>  Nellie
>
